timeline.message:
Improve Bulk and OAuth Support #1110

- Add Support for SQL Type SmallInt
- Add Support for multi-column unique constraints
- Improve Foreign Key Constraints for self-referenced foreign keys
(JavaBatch) and update BaseObject to work with FK
- Improve Foreign Key Constraints for Alternative Targets (columns don't
match)
- Add Restrictive Grants for OAuth Tables
- Add Restrictive Grants for Java Batch Tables
- Add Feature Flag for Grants in Schema / Main
- Added SchemaPrinter support for OAuth and JBatch
- Tuned logging for DerbyAdapter (tablespace is now log level fine)
- Tuned logging for ParametersUtil ( changed warning name-code match to
log level fine)
- Tuned DerbyAdapter warnings

Indirectly fixed...
- Add postgresql support for grant command of the schema tool #946

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

After discuss with @lmsurpre , we agree that both oauth and batch has the same issue. and we'd better allow to use different databases for batch and oauth which is/are shared by the whole service. so the wanted changes are: admin always created with each database; and admin keep info for schemas in the same database, not matter they are fhirbath, oauth or fhirdata; and fhirbatch, oauth or fhirdata schema can be updated seperately.

replies.bodyText:
Paul added separate actions for
    --update-schema-fhir SCHEMANAME
    --update-schema-batch SCHEMANAME
    --update-schema-oauth SCHEMANAME

while preserving the existing behavior of --update-schema.
I think the updated design manages to walk the fine line of backwards-compatibility while still adding the requested functionality.
